cc: Activity 4: Equalizing the Hoses and Disconnecting the AC Machine
Always be sure to equalize the hoses after performing a system charge.
Now that the high-side pressure has reached 40 psi, you can close the hand valves.

t2.cc: Remove the high-side hose from the vehicle.
t2.reportLabel: Remove the high side hose from the vehicle.

t4.cc: Rotate the low-side hand valve on the AC machine to open it.
t4.reportLabel: Open the low side hand valve.

t5.cc: Now rotate the high-side hand valve to open it.
t5.reportLabel: Open the high side hand valve.

t6.cc: Rotate the high-side hand valve to close it.
t6.reportLabel: Close the low side hand valve.

t7.cc: Now rotate the other valve to close it.
t7.reportLabel: Close the high side hand valve.

t8.cc: Remove the low-side hose from the vehicle.
t8.reportLabel: Remove the low side hose from the vehicle.

t10.cc: Select the Power button to turn off the AC machine.

t11.cc: Drag the vehicle's low-side service port cap from the parts tray back into place.
t11.reportLabel: Cap the low side service port.

t12.cc: Now, drag the vehicle's high-side service port cap from the parts tray back into place.
t12.reportLabel: Cap the high side service port.
